page.title: 04SOCIAL SURVEY-COSSINGTON
page.content: Several people have moved into the village in the last year. Over a third of the population in the village have lived there ten years or more. The same proportion came from more than fifty miles. There was only one person in a third of the households. A majority had no children. The children tended to be under eleven. Some older children had to travel to school. Most of the population in this village are retired. Hobbies were common, the most popular being gardening. Pets were owned by half of the people, the most popular being dogs. Shopping was done locally by half the people, one third spent their leisure locally. A car was the most usual transport, but a third used the bus. Most people rated their amenities as good.
